org.strongback.components

Interface AngleSensor

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Zeroable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Compass, Gyroscope
    Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.

    @ThreadSafe
 @FunctionalInterface
public interface AngleSensor
extends Zeroable
    A sensor that returns an angle. The sensor's can be zeroed to reset the angle at which the sensor considers 0 degrees.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default double computeAngleChangeTo(double targetAngle, double tolerance)
      Compute the change in angle between the current angle and the target angle, using the given tolerance for the difference.
      static AngleSensor create(DoubleSupplier angleSupplier)
      Create an angle sensor around the given function that returns the angle.
      double getAngle()
      Gets the angular displacement in continuous degrees.
      static AngleSensor invert(AngleSensor sensor)
      Inverts the specified AngleSensor so that negative angles become positive angles.
      default AngleSensor zero()
      Change the output so that the current angle is considered to be 0.

    • Method Detail

      • getAngle

        double getAngle()
        Gets the angular displacement in continuous degrees.
        Returns:
        the positive or negative angular displacement

      • zero

        default AngleSensor zero()
        Change the output so that the current angle is considered to be 0.
        Specified by:
        zero in interface Zeroable
        Returns:
        this object to allow chaining of methods; never null

      • computeAngleChangeTo

        default double computeAngleChangeTo(double targetAngle,
                                    double tolerance)
        Compute the change in angle between the current angle and the target angle, using the given tolerance for the difference. The result is the angle that this sensor must rotate to reach the target angle, and may be positive or negative
        Parameters:
        targetAngle - the target angle
        tolerance - the allowed tolerance in degrees between the two angles
        Returns:
        the positive or negative angular displacement required for this sensor to reach the target angle, or 0.0d if the two angles are already within the specified tolerance

      • create

        static AngleSensor create(DoubleSupplier angleSupplier)
        Create an angle sensor around the given function that returns the angle.
        Parameters:
        angleSupplier - the function that returns the angle; may not be null
        Returns:
        the angle sensor

      • invert

        static AngleSensor invert(AngleSensor sensor)
        Inverts the specified AngleSensor so that negative angles become positive angles.
        Parameters:
        sensor - the AngleSensor to invert
        Returns:
        an AngleSensor that reads the opposite of the original sensor
